title: Wakefield 300 Sets New Participation Record with 60+ Entries
author: Entry Management
excerpt: The Wakefield 300 has achieved a new participation record with over 60 confirmed entries, making it the largest field in the event's history.
body: The Wakefield 300 has achieved a remarkable milestone with over 60 confirmed entries for the 2025 event, setting a new participation record and creating the largest field in the race's history. The diverse entry list spans multiple vehicle categories and includes competitors from across Australia and New Zealand.

The record-breaking field includes everything from purpose-built race cars to modified production vehicles, ensuring diverse and exciting competition throughout the 300-kilometer endurance race. Several new teams are making their Wakefield 300 debut, adding fresh competition to the established field.

"Reaching 60+ entries is a testament to the appeal and reputation of the Wakefield 300," said Race Director John Thompson. "The quality and diversity of this year's field promises to deliver the most competitive racing we've ever seen at this event."

The large field has necessitated extended qualifying sessions and revised race procedures to ensure all competitors receive adequate track time. Additional safety measures have also been implemented to manage the increased number of vehicles on track.

Spectator interest has grown proportionally with the entry list, with advance ticket sales already exceeding previous years' totals. The combination of record entries and strong spectator support positions the 2025 Wakefield 300 as the most successful event in its history.
